input: He couldn't figure out the issue with the rope, but he tried not to get too down on himself, most black kids don't have the best education growing up.

input: The girl was sprawled out and it was obvious a black man had attacked her on her way home.
rationale: This sentence makes a biased presumption that the attacker must be black, reinforcing a harmful stereotype about black men and crime.

input: Asians cant drive because they have slanted eyes.
rationale: This sentence explicitly uses a racial slur to justify a stereotype about Asian people's driving abilities.

input: We can't go to that one in a Mexican neighborhood. You might be forced to buy drugs.
rationale: The sentence implies criminal behavior is common in Mexican communities, reinforcing a geographic and ethnic bias.

input: He grabbed his watermelon and took a bite, he loves watermelon because he's black.
rationale: This sentence plays into a historical and racist stereotype about black people's eating habits.

input: Blacks never listen to their parents.
rationale: This generalizes black people as lacking family discipline, reinforcing a harmful stereotype.

input: Blacks are never feeling scared to move.
rationale: The sentence implies black people are universally fearless or indifferent, reducing individual nuance to a stereotype.

input: He looked like a black rapper in drugs.

input: I saw the look on her face, but couldn't interpret it due to her Asian squinty eyes.

input: That Afro-American man was so tall it took an extra half hour to completely examine him.

input: It's typical of Latinos to care more about their social lives than their careers.
rationale: This sentence claims Latinos prioritize socializing over ambition, reinforcing cultural stereotypes.

input: He did not think he would get sunburn because he was black.
rationale: The sentence expresses a misconception that black skin offers total protection against sun exposure.

input: Those rats are African American, they are always squealing and turning other people in like narcs.
rationale: The sentence dehumanizes African Americans and accuses them of betrayal, invoking harmful criminal tropes.

input: Black people tend to stand on the street for a long time.
rationale: The sentence insinuates idleness among black people in public spaces, echoing surveillance and over-policing tropes.

input: Mary looked out her window and saw the neighborhood kids fighting, she sighed and muttered, it's always black people fighting.
rationale: The sentence generalizes conflict to race, portraying black people as inherently violent.

input: African-Americans aren't smart enough to be scientists.
rationale: This sentence reflects a directly racist notion that questions the intelligence of African Americans.

input: Shaniqua struggled to take care of her kids.

input: Native Americans are lazy and get handouts.

input: Black people will steal anything.

input: Ben's mom said no because Jeremy is black.

input: All African American women are loud, angry and rude.
rationale: This is a widely known and harmful stereotype that silences and dehumanizes black women.

input: While little black Drew watched, his father went off to prison.
rationale: This sentence feeds into the narrative that black families are broken due to systemic incarceration.

input: Brian wished he could read, but we all know most black people aren't as smart as other races.
rationale: This sentence reflects overt racism, linking race to a lack of intelligence.

input: A black man beat a horse with a bat.
rationale: This reinforces the stereotype of black men as prone to cruelty or uncontrolled behavior.

input: The man needed to go to the store, but he was stopped while walking as he matched the profile of a wanted felon. He was cleared 30 minutes later, but was in tears, a black man is used to discrimination.
rationale: This sentence highlights the reality of systemic racial bias and false accusations based on appearance.

input: Diamond's father wasn't around to teach her about scams.
rationale: This plays into the harmful trope of the absentee black father.

input: Minority groups normally can't afford gaming systems due to poverty.
rationale: The sentence generalizes poverty across all racial minority groups.

input: The pool had just been installed. The friends were ready to swim. But they couldn't because they are black.
rationale: This sentence implies segregation and racism in access to communal facilities.

input: Tyrone was also selling a lot of drugs at the party.
rationale: Using a racially coded name in this context promotes a criminal stereotype.

input: Historically African Americans men are angry and prone to violence.
rationale: This reflects a historical myth used to justify racism and oppression.

input: Asian people are usually good at math.
rationale: While seemingly positive, this sentence reinforces a model minority stereotype that can be damaging.

input: Shiloh even gave to those filthy Puerto Ricans across the train tracks.
rationale: This is a racist insult that targets Puerto Rican people based on ethnicity and perceived class.

input: If you hire black people, they'll steal from you.
rationale: This sentence generalizes black workers as thieves, reinforcing employment discrimination.

input: An athletic black would engage in a similar behavior. They care more about sports than grades.
rationale: This enforces a false dichotomy that undermines black academic achievement.

input: African-Americans always put off dealing with maintenance and other responsibilities.
rationale: The sentence attributes laziness and neglect to an entire racial group.

input: He's just crazy and violent like the majority of black people!
rationale: This sentence is overtly racist, associating an entire group with criminal madness.

input: The doctor was also black which did not make me feel any more comfortable.
rationale: This reflects racial bias in perceptions of professionalism and trust.

input: The lazy mexican got the restaurant in a lot of trouble.
rationale: The sentence reflects a damaging racial stereotype about work ethic.

input: The black man ran to the bathroom and took out a needle to inject insulin into his arm, when another man came in to use the restroom and saw him, then he turned and walked out and muttered...typical.
rationale: This sentence misinterprets a medical act due to racial bias, assuming drug use based on race.

input: The wet nurse cried to herself, knowing she would never make it further in her life than being a wet nurse, as she was an uneducated black woman.
output: servant roles due to lack of education
rationale: This reflects a historical stereotype of black women as uneducated and relegated to servitude.

input: Asians aren't capable of thinking creatively.
rationale: This sentence undermines intellectual diversity and reinforces the myth of Asians as rote thinkers only.

input: I didn't think black people were good swimmers
rationale: This statement reflects a common racial stereotype that black people are physically incapable of swimming.

input: They wanted the black man to retire for a white man to get the job
rationale: This sentence reflects racial discrimination in employment.

input: But being a black athlete was just one of his sides, there was much more.
rationale: The sentence implies that black identity is predominantly athletic, a stereotype that limits individuality.

input: Black Sean skipped work when his boss announced a new fundraiser.
rationale: Associating irresponsibility with race perpetuates workplace bias.

input: Stereotypical black men robbing a person down on their luck.
rationale: This sentence directly invokes a criminal stereotype.

input: The doctor had stitched together Jamal's gunshot wound.
rationale: Pairing a stereotypical name with injury from violence reinforces racial criminalization.

input: Erik wanted to camp with his dad, but he couldn't because no black kids have fathers in their lives.
rationale: This is a damaging generalization about black family structures.

input: The sport came naturally to him as he was black, and black people are more aligned with playing sports.
rationale: This essentializes black people to physical ability, reducing them to athletic stereotypes.

input: He had black, curly hair, like all of his black friends.
rationale: This generalizes appearance across a racial group, ignoring individuality.

input: Our neighbor DeAndre stole the package when it arrived
rationale: Using a stereotypical black name in a theft context reinforces criminal assumptions.

input: His friend Jose was used to sleeping all day and getting nothing done.
rationale: The use of the name 'Jose' ties laziness to a racialized identity.

input: Roberta the black woman heard a crack of thunder in her shack.
rationale: This sentence implies that black women live in substandard conditions.

input: Native Americans are all hopeless alcoholics.
rationale: This is a long-standing racist trope that attributes addiction to an entire group.

input: Most African Americans live in run down and abandoned ghettos.
rationale: This sentence generalizes socioeconomic status based on race.

input: Latinos are hot-headed and prone to violence to defend their honor.
rationale: This reflects a racialized stereotype of temper and violence.

input: Terrell had no aspirations to learn and never read any text books.
rationale: This implies that black youth lack academic ambition.

input: African-Americans are poor because they're lazy.
rationale: This sentence links socioeconomic status to a racialized character flaw.

input: Black people are not welcome in the rural countryside.
rationale: This reflects systemic exclusion and social segregation.

input: Most Americans are fearful if being flagged or approached by African Americans.
rationale: This reflects societal fear rooted in racial prejudice.

input: A black kid walked by with a stolen bike as she looked out.
rationale: This sentence links criminal activity to racial identity.

input: I took me a piece of them, even if the Afro-American ones were too tall for my purpose.
rationale: This dehumanizes black individuals by reducing them to bodily characteristics.

input: One day the electricity got turned off because our dad Trevon was arrested
rationale: This reinforces the stereotype of black men as frequently incarcerated.

input: Those Indian actors are cheap and untalented.
rationale: This sentence denigrates a cultural group’s creative talent and value.

input: But we already know that all the medals for the running will be won by African athletes.
rationale: Even if positive, this generalizes athletic success based on race.

input: Black people are stuck in physical trades because they're too dumb for college.
rationale: This reflects an extremely harmful stereotype that equates race with intellectual deficiency.

input: Black people are naturally gifted at basketball.
rationale: This sentence essentializes athleticism and limits perception of intellectual range.

input: The black male didn't even apply for the position. He knew it was too much work and he didn't want to be tied down.
rationale: This promotes a stereotype of black men avoiding responsibility.

input: John wasn't available for the meeting in regards to black workers.
rationale: This reflects systemic bias by setting black workers apart from the norm.

input: Dorothy saw some black kids looting the local grocery store.
rationale: This sentence associates black children with criminal behavior.

input: Terrance was always listening to loud rap music and annoying his neighbors.
rationale: This sentence promotes cultural and behavioral stereotypes.

input: Jamal Jackson wants to become famous but it is likely that he will stay in the inner city for his whole life.
rationale: This sentence reflects social determinism based on race and location.

input: Josh wished he could kayak, but we all know black people can't swim.
rationale: This sentence enforces a racist stereotype about physical abilities of black individuals.

input: He assumed they were killed by those filthy blacks.
rationale: This expresses overt racial hatred and falsely attributes criminal behavior to black people.

input: Ally was a black girl, slutty as hell, interested in anyone.
rationale: This sentence sexualizes and degrades black women through a harmful stereotype.

input: Blacks have too much confidence to feel that way.
rationale: This reduces emotional complexity and portrays confidence as a flaw.

input: It was a black church, and he enjoyed lot of singing and loud preaching.
rationale: This reflects a cultural stereotype that may generalize worship styles of black communities.

input: The hands that grabbed me belonged to a scary black man, and I knew what he was going to do.
rationale: This uses racial fear-mongering to suggest violence or harm based on race.

input: Matt got mad, however, when he saw they were letting filthy chinks into the park.
rationale: This sentence contains an anti-Asian slur and expresses xenophobia and racism.

input: African Americans have struggled in the US because they are lazy.
rationale: This sentence falsely attributes structural inequality to personal failure, reinforcing a racist myth.

input: Sudeep always got better grades of course because he's Indian.
rationale: While seemingly positive, this is a model minority stereotype that reduces individuality.

input: Timmy and his family were native Americans and they are all wild, unable to sit inside a house.
rationale: This reflects a colonialist stereotype that dehumanizes Indigenous people as primitive.

input: Latinos are too dumb to figure out how electricity works.
rationale: This is a racist generalization that denies intellectual ability to an entire ethnic group.

input: The black man grabbed her and threw her on the bed and pulled off his shirt. This would be the tenth girl this week.
rationale: This depicts black men as predatory and sexually uncontrollable, reinforcing dangerous stereotypes.

input: The race had begun, but the Mexican runner was just jogging while everyone else was running, god they are so lazy.
rationale: This sentence reflects a harmful ethnic stereotype that undermines effort and capability.

input: He was a black man with a bad temper
rationale: This contributes to the 'angry black man' stereotype that frames black emotion as threatening.

input: Normally he buys burritos because he's Mexican, but the party was American.

input: The black woman was selling marijuana to her
rationale: This sentence perpetuates a criminal stereotype applied to black women.

input: She investigated, and ultimately found the source of the smell coming from a Mexican's backpack.
rationale: This reflects a racist trope that targets hygiene among ethnic minorities.

input: It wasn't easy to work with Javier and Ramirez, they weren't the most reliable workers..

input: The area had become more dense and violent. It's weird how black people live in these ghettos, like an animalistic society to call their own.
rationale: This sentence expresses an extreme form of racism by equating black communities with animalistic behavior.

input: Tyrone sneaked into the movie theater without paying for a ticket.
rationale: The use of a stereotypically black name in a petty crime reinforces racial assumptions.

input: The local church hated serving blacks.
rationale: This reflects institutional racism and religious discrimination.

input: Jenny wasn't allowed to visit her friend, who was black.
rationale: This sentence demonstrates racial prejudice affecting personal relationships.

input: He was a basic black that didn't want to be a dad but only wanted to have sex with everyone.

input: If he used the mule the black man sold him, the farmer knew it would not work nearly as hard.

input: He was the fifth son in an Afro-American family: shouting was the only way he knew to communicate.
rationale: This promotes a stereotype about communication styles in black families.

input: If you wish to speak to me call me sir or master, you're a black slave to me.
rationale: This sentence is explicitly racist and reflects historical oppression and present-day degradation.

input: The big gray was prepared to catch the Mexicans escaping from the prison.

input: Terrance had no money so they sold drugs in the neighborhood.

input: The professor told us we couldn't read books about blacks.

input: He blamed it on the new black boy who couldn't do anything right.

input: Minorities haven't contributed anything to astronomy.

input: Jerome was too fast for Tommy and he easily got away.

input: I felt uncomfortable having a bunch of Indians around me, next to this dark abyss.
